meanings.definition: A volume containing several works by one author.
meanings.sent1: I borrowed an omnibus from the library with all of Mark Twain's stories.
meanings.sent2: The omnibus on the shelf includes all the poems by Emily Dickinson.
meanings.sent3: The omnibus of fairy tales was so heavy, it could be used as a weight for exercise.
meanings.sent4: Her mind was an omnibus of knowledge, each book a different chapter.
meanings.sent5: The omnibus of recipes was a treasure trove for any aspiring chef.

meanings.sent1: The omnibus arrived at the station right on time.
meanings.sent2: We took the omnibus to the countryside for a relaxing weekend.
meanings.sent3: The omnibus driver greeted each passenger with a cheerful smile.
meanings.sent4: The omnibus rumbled along the road, carrying passengers to their destinations.
meanings.sent5: The colorful design of the omnibus made it stand out among other vehicles.

meanings.sent1: The omnibus survey collected data from a wide range of participants.
meanings.sent2: Her speech was an omnibus summary of all the key points discussed.
meanings.sent3: The omnibus approach to problem-solving involved considering all possible solutions.
meanings.sent4: The omnibus policy addressed various issues in a comprehensive manner.
meanings.sent5: The omnibus exhibition showcased art from different cultures around the world.
